item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, January 27, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Google has open-sourced the Pebble smartwatch operating system (78 points | 7 comments)
2. The Taylorator – All Your Frequencies Are Belong to Us (140 points | 37 comments)
3. DeepSeek releases Janus Pro, a text-to-image generator [pdf] (330 points | 202 comments)
4. Operation Leg – a pilot unlike any other (2020) (150 points | 61 comments)
5. The Alpha Myth: How Captive Wolves Led Us Astray (10 points | 3 comments)
6. My failed attempt to shrink all NPM packages by 5% (238 points | 149 comments)
7. Bilinear down/upsampling, aligning pixel grids, and that infamous GPU half pixel (2021) (79 points | 6 comments)
8. The Ocean Teems with Networks of Interconnected Bacteria (21 points | 3 comments)
9. The Curious Case of Quentell (47 points | 2 comments)
10. Show HN: I Made an iOS Podcast Player with Racket (147 points | 47 comments)
11. Oliver Heaviside and the theory of transmission lines (2021) (199 points | 59 comments)
12. Pebble smartwatch firmware released as open-source (3 points | discuss)
13. Solving complex billable metrics with custom SQL expressions in Lago (6 points | discuss)
14. Show HN: I Created ErisForge, a Python Library for Abliteration of LLMs (72 points | 35 comments)
15. Using the Rust standard library with the NuttX RTOS (34 points | 10 comments)
16. Facebook ban on discussing Linux? (177 points | 58 comments)
17. Mineral Oil Cooled PC (2014) (32 points | 16 comments)
18. Peanut Butter Day: Going Nuts over NIST's Standard Reference Peanut Butter (2016) (69 points | 42 comments)
19. SiFive's P550 Microarchitecture (117 points | 36 comments)
20. Non-random uniform disk sampling (26 points | 17 comments)
21. A layoff fundamentally changed how I perceive work (769 points | 709 comments)
22. A Faster Quantum Fourier Transform (5 points | 1 comment)
23. Openhaystack: Build 'AirTags' – track Bluetooth devices via Apple's network (391 points | 95 comments)
24. TBM 333: Lean Graph Theory (9 points | 2 comments)
25. Show HN: Making AR experiences is still painful – had to make my own editor (138 points | 26 comments)
26. The impact of competition and DeepSeek on Nvidia (518 points | 333 comments)
27. C is not suited to SIMD (2019) (64 points | 61 comments)
28. Lessons in creating family photos that people want to keep (2018) (336 points | 132 comments)
29. Hedy: Textual programming made easy (185 points | 74 comments)
30. Show HN: DeepSeek My User Agent (333 points | 133 comments)
